title: Impact of Media Ecology and Distance Education on Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: A non-degree course for working professionals exploring the impact of media environments on mathematics learning amid the normalization of remote education post-COVID-19, emphasizing practical applicability.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the strengths and weaknesses of distance mathematics education using core concepts of media ecology
Learners can explain the differences between oral and written learning approaches by applying them to mathematical problem-solving processes
Learners can discuss the impact of technological changes on mathematical communication and comprehension

resources: Media Ecology-Related Papers and Case Materials

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
